title: Large collection of T206s for sale
author: Archive

posts.post_title: Large collection of T206s for sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Al C.risafulli
Hi folks:



I've decided for the third time in my life that the Monster has whupped me, and it's time for me to walk away from all but the T206 Hall of Famers.

So, on the eve of T206s' 100th Anniversary, I am looking to sell my collection.

The collection consists of 165 cards, with very few dupes.  While no Hall of Famers are included, there are some Southern Leaguers, minor stars, and a few tougher backs.  The cards average in the Good to Very Good range, with some better and some worse.

48 of the cards have been graded by SGC, 1 has been graded by Global, and all the rest remain ungraded.

I am offering them here as one group, and looking for the best offer over $4,000.  I prefer checks or money orders.

For more information on the group, and some representative scans, please visit my web page at [URL="http://www.swingbattaswing.com/page2/page2.html"]http://www.swingbattaswing.com/page2/page2.html>



Thanks for your interest.



-Al[/URL]

posts.post_title: Large collection of T206s for sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: barry arnold
Al,
I'm shocked to see this since you're well on your way.
Knowing you, I'm sure that you've thought through this again and again and anguished over it,
and then arrived at the proper decision.
I'm behind you, ole buddy. Just joinin' in the pain a bit.

best,

barry

posts.post_title: Large collection of T206s for sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Al C.risafulli
Friendly bump.

(and thanks for the comments, Barry - I'm sticking with the HOFers, but I figure I can always work on the set again if I get motivated).

-Al
